神学校: (しんがっこう) - theological school; seminary
神学生: (しんがくせい) - theological student; seminary student
神宮: (jinguu) - santuário xintoísta de alto prestígio com ligação à família imperial, santuário xintoísta imperial
神宮外苑: (じんぐうがいえん) - outer gardens of Meiji Shrine
神宮奉斎会: (じんぐうほうさいかい) - Ise Shrine Offering Association (secular organization formed from Jingu-kyo in 1899; dissolved in 1946)
神宮寺: (じんぐうじ) - Buddhist temple within a Shinto shrine; temple attached to a shrine
神宮教: (じんぐうきょう) - Jingu-kyo (sect of Shinto, dissolved in 1899)
神宮暦: (じんぐうれき) - calendar distributed by the Ise shrine
神宮球場: (じんぐうきゅうじょう) - Jingu Stadium
神将: (しんしょう) - divine generals who protect pilgrims, etc.
神州: (しんしゅう) - land of the gods; Japan; China
神巫: (いちこ) - sorceress/medium/female fortuneteller; (市子 only)  child from the city
神幸: (じんこう) - {Shinto}  transferring a shintai in a portable shrine, e.g. to another shrine or to a ceremony
神幸祭: (しんこうさい) - {Shinto}  festival celebrating the (temporary) transfer of a shintai away from its main shrine
神座: (しんざ) - place where there is a god or spirit; place containing the sacred object of a shrine
神庫: (じんこ) - (ほくら only)  small shrine; depository for sacred objects
神式: (しんしき) - Shinto rites; Shinto style
神彩: (しんさい) - surpassing looks/exceptional appearance; mind and appearance
神憑: (かみがかり) - divine possession; eccentric behavior; fanaticism
神憑り: (かみがかり) - divine possession; eccentric behavior; fanaticism
神懸かり: (かみがかり) - divine possession; eccentric behavior; fanaticism
神懸り: (かみがかり) - divine possession; eccentric behavior; fanaticism
神戸土竜: (コウベモグラ) - Japanese mole (Mogera wogura); Temminck's mole
神戸育ち: (こうべそだち) - raised in Kobe
神掛けて: (かみかけて) - swear by god; absolutely
神族: (しんぞく) - divine being; inhabitant of heaven
神明: (しんめい) - deity/god; Amaterasu (as an enshrined deity)
神明社: (しんめいしゃ) - (post-Heian) shrine dedicated to Amaterasu
神明裁判: (しんめいさいばん) - trial by ordeal
神明造: (しんめいづくり) - style of shrine architecture based on that of Ise Jingu
神明造り: (しんめいづくり) - style of shrine architecture based on that of Ise Jingu
神有月: (かみありづき) - (term used in Izumo Province)  tenth month of the lunar calendar
神木: (かみき) - sacred tree; (しんぼく only) support pillars of the traditional fire festival bonfires
神札: (しんさつ) - type of amulet sold at Shinto shrines
神棚: (かみだな) - {Shinto} household shrine; home shrine
神業: (かんわざ) - divine work/miracle/superhuman feat; Shinto ritual
神楽: (かぐら) - ancient Shinto music and dancing
神楽堂: (かぐらどう) - kagura hall (at a shrine)
神楽殿: (かぐらでん) - kagura hall (at a shrine)
神楽獅子: (かぐらじし) - kagurajishi camelia; Camellia japonica var.
神楽笛: (かぐらぶえ) - kagura flute (six-holed horizontal flute)
神楽蝙蝠: (カグラコウモリ) - lesser great leaf-nosed bat (Hipposideros turpis); lesser roundleaf bat; lesser leaf-nosed bat
神楽鮫: (カグラザメ) - bluntnose sixgill shark (Hexanchus griseus)
神様仏様: (かみさまほとけさま) - God and Buddha; Gods and Buddhas; one's guardian angel
神権: (しんけん) - divine right (e.g. of kings)
神機妙算: (しんきみょうさん) - (yoji) inscrutable stratagem; ingenious scheme
神武: (じんむ) - Emperor Jinmu; legendary founding Emperor of Japan
神武以来: (じんむこのかた) - (yoji) since the era of the Emperor Jinmu; (first ever) since the dawn of Japan's history; unprecedented
神武天皇祭: (じんむてんのうさい) - Festival of Emperor Jimmu (formerly held annually on April 3rd, the supposed day of his death)
神武景気: (じんむけいき) - (yoji) the economic boom of the mid-1950s
神気: (しんき) - the elements; spirit; mind; divinity
神水: (じんすい) - water offered to God/water drunk before an altar to symbolize the making of a vow; miracle-working water; water which gathers in the nodes of bamboo after falling as rain at noon on the 5th day of the 5th month (lunar calendar), thought to be effective when used in medicines
神漿: (しんしょう) - ambrosia (drink conferring immortality); drink used as an offering (to the gods)
神無月: (かみなづき) - tenth month of the lunar calendar
神父: (しんぷ) - Catholic priest; abbe; reverend father; minister; padre
神獣鏡: (しんじゅうきょう) - ancient mirror decorated with gods and animals
神理教: (しんりきょう) - Shinri-kyo (sect of Shinto)
神璽: (しんじ) - Imperial regalia (esp. the jewel Yasakani no Magatama); emperor's seal
神田: (かみた) - field affiliated with a shrine (the tax-exempt proceeds of its harvest going to pay for shrine operations)
神田祭: (かんだまつり) - Kanda Festival (held at Kanda Myoujin Shrine in Tokyo on May 15)
神相撲: (かみずもう) - {Shinto}  part of the shrine dedication ceremony at the Hachiman shrine in Yoshitomi, where articulated wooden dolls enact a sumo bout
神社仏閣: (じんじゃぶっかく) - (yoji) (Shinto) shrines and (Buddhist) temples
神社局: (じんじゃきょく) - Bureau of Shrine Affairs (1900-1940)
神社神道: (じんじゃしんとう) - Shrine Shinto
神祇: (じんぎ) - gods of heaven and earth
神祇伯: (じんぎはく) - head of the Department of Worship
